com.wx.properties.page

Class ResourcePage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wx.properties.PropertiesManager
      • com.wx.properties.page.ResourcePage

  • public class ResourcePage
extends PropertiesManager
    This class wraps a LocatedPropertiesOld into a structure with the following features for a property file:

    • Access control (with reserved keys), used only for other features.
    • Advanced structure storage (as lists, maps or sets).
    • Possibility to store any type of objects (instead of just strings) thanks to the use of casters
    • Crypter caching for encrypted files (so no need to specify it when saving back).
    • Watches for any changes in the content and uses this information to minimize useless disk saves. If no change has been detected, the save() method will not perform anything. This will allow the user to abuse the save() with limited performance loss. However, note that this performs a soft watch, meaning, it will detect any activity on the properties but will not deeply check that a newly set property is strictly different from the previous one. In that specific case, saving will perform an unnecessary disk IO.
      Also note that this feature can be by-passed using the forceSave() method.

    // TODO: 1/15/16 Clean this all up // TODO: 1/15/16 Have the encoding as an attribute

    See Also:
    ResourceWrapper

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static PageBuilder builder()

      • save

        public boolean save()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Saves this page using the corresponding OutputLink.

        This resource page watches for changes, and if no change has been detected, this method will not do anything. See ResourcePage for more info.

        Returns:
        false if this page did not change and was not saved, true if it was saved.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • load

        public void load()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • forceSave

        public void forceSave()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Saves this page using the corresponding OutputLink.

        This method will save this page into disk regardless to the fact that it has been modified or not.

        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        save()
